item.p: There is a gap between ἐλάσ and σους: the editor explained it by an original crease in the papyrus, not comparable with the spaces deliberately left between commata.
There is a horizontal line above the surviving left hasta of η. According to the editor, it doesn't look much like a breathing, but he has no other suggestion for it.

div.p: In MP3 the papyri are recognised by different numbers: under 1521.100 are identified P.Oxy. 17.2100 + P.Oxy. 57.3891, under 1522.071 PSI 16.1587 (PSI 1933a + b + c), under 1526.120 x PL III/1001 + x 0 PL III/976, under 01532.110 P.Oxy. 61.4109. The dimensions of each papyrus are the followings: P.Oxy. 17 2100 Fr. 8 28.5x17 cm; P.Oxy. 57 3891 18.5x8.1 cm; P.Oxy. 61 4109 Fr. 1 6.5x8.5 cm; Anal. Pap. 16-17, p. 6 (PL III/976) 5.1x3.4 cm; PSI 16 1587 a:5x6 cm, b:2.4x3.8 cm, c:2.3x4.5 cm; Anal. Pap. 23-24, pp. 11-16 (PL III /1001) 3.9x5.7 cm. The columns are ordered according toThυcydides’ work (and consequently to the succession in the original papyrus roll or “set of rolls”).
